attributes.action: leave music copyright law as it is
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
After fifty years, they've had enough royalties. The major record companies are sitting on piles of tracks they won't re-issue, putting the consumer at a disadvantage. We deserve the choice. So much music will never be heard again if this law is changed.

It's argued that the law is ruining the record industry. What about the record industry that consists of companies making a living off public domain recordings? If the law changes, they will all be out of jobs.
